description:
it needs undo for accidentally deleting cells (run and delete very near)

side panels (variables, files) should be collapsible as in Kate
Cantor closed unexpectedly. App could not started. A restart did not help. App could not tested.

Tried even synaptic, it can't launch.
Even terminal ... 
It was working with ubuntu 12.04 and 16.04.
summary: A great product but not with ubuntu 20.04

description: It wouldn't open up on my dell latitude e5430 running Ununtu 20.04. A disappointment indeed.
it work really well if using white theme in kubuntu, but if using black theme we couldn't see the font
summary: it work if using white theme

description:
The ability to import different backends for handling the math is excellent idea. Unfortunately on my installation Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS, I had to use sudo cantor to get to work with Maxima. It would not start the Maxima backend. One needs to install the back math software (this is not well documented in the Cantor help guide. 
One improvement would be in a latex cell, to centre text.
summary: Great application, but improvement still needed

description: latest version (23.08.3) doesn't recognize backgrounds installed with snap or apt (maxima, octave)
summary: the snap doesn't recognize the maxima installation
